title: Book of Mormon References to Isaiah 52
html:

6-7 1 Nephi 13:37 — Mosiah 12:21, Mosiah 15:14-18 3 Nephi 20:39-40 Mosiah 27:37
8-10 1 Nephi 22:10-11 — Mosiah 12:22-24, Mosiah 15:29-31 3 Nephi 16:18-20, 3 Nephi 20:32-35 —
11-12 — — — 3 Nephi 20:41-42, 3 Nephi 21:29 —

As will be seen in the later discussion in this chapter, Christ’s commentary on this material not only stresses its importance but also gives fuller understanding of its messages.

The Savior uses the words of Isaiah during the second day of His ministry in the Americas to stress that when Isaiah’s prophecies are fulfilled, the Father’s covenant with Israel will also be fulfilled (3 Nephi 20:11–12). Thus, Isaiah’s words truly are significant to our day—because God’s covenant with Israel will not be accomplished until Isaiah’s prophecies are realized.

Following this important disclosure concerning the covenant relevance of Isaiah’s words, the Savior teaches about different aspects of the covenant remaining to be fulfilled, culminating with the gospel restoration. He then quotes most of Isaiah 52, arranging the verses in a slightly different order than found in Isaiah:

3 Nephi 20 Isaiah 52
vv. 32–35 vv. 8–10
vv. 36–38 vv. 1–3
vv. 39–40 vv. 6–7
vv. 41–45 vv. 11–15

The different order of the verses does not detract from their meaning, so we will discuss them in the order presented by the Savior.
